page.title: 03Smarden West - Employment
page.content: There is no heavy industry in this block but various enterprises have sprung up, giving local employment. Small farms have, in many cases, ceased to be viable as separate holdings. Some have been absorbed into larger units, others have to rely on extra income provided by the wife working away from home or in many cases the farmer takes a second job while the wife keeps things going at home and on the farm. Sometimes Farmhouses and buildings have been taken over by people starting up light industrial projects, a case in point being Bounds Cross where plastic bags are made. Cider factories once abounded but have almost disappeared. One, mentioned in the intro, situated beside the Bell Inn and now producing plastic stampings, is a family concern and employs only 5 people.
